text: For nearly 30 years, Doug served as a member of the National Guard, protecting our country at home and abroad, and his family served right alongside him. We join the Mandan community in mourning their loss and offer our prayers on behalf of all their friends and loved ones.

Mikey and I send our deepest condolences to the Larsen family following the tragic loss of ND State Senator Doug Larsen, his wife, Amy, and their two children. We honor their memory and dedication to their community, state and nation.
We need to get back to regular order so we can fund the priorities of the American people, while also finding savings to get control of our debt and deficit
This short-term CR will keep government open. At the same time, we’re working to get back to regular order, where we pass appropriations bills through the committee & debate them on the floor.

She was a dedicated legislator and a gracious colleague. While we were most often on the opposite sides of issues, I appreciated her support for programs that help us build water infrastructure in North Dakota. Mikey and I extend our sincerest condolences to her loved ones.
Senator Feinstein spent her life in public service, including representing the people of California in the United States Senate for more than thirty years.

Called on the Biden admin to enforce the law & secure the nation’s borders. The numbers speak for themselves. In 2021, illegal crossings were at 1.7 million, w/ 2.4 million illegal crossings in 2022. By October 2023, it will be a new record yet again. piped.video/BkzLuM4pF2U
Projects like this are possible due to the federal resources that we’ve worked to make available to enable developers to leverage private investment and secure a better value for taxpayers.

This weekend we ushered in new affordable housing for the FM region with the demolition of the Lashkowitz Tower. The new Lashkowitz Riverfront will be a high-quality development, offering modern amenities and comfort that any individual would want, regardless of income level.

This week I joined Senator Cruz in introducing legislation that will force the Biden administration to secure the border. That includes resuming construction on the border wall, ending catch and release, and providing additional resources for our Border Patrol.
I’ve traveled to the southern border repeatedly to draw attention to the national security and humanitarian crisis that the Biden administration is causing with its open-border policies.

We will never forget the sacrifices made, both that day & in the years that followed, as the incredible men & women of the U.S. Armed Forces answered the call to defend our great nation in the war on terror. We know the cost of our freedom & security, & we must remember it always

Today, we look back & remember the horrific terrorist attacks against our nation, not only to mourn the lives lost, but to honor the victims’ memory & express our deep gratitude to the first responders for their courage in the midst of this terrible tragedy.

DAPL is vital energy infrastructure for our nation that has been safely operating for six years. We will continue working to get the Army Corps to complete this process and provide certainty to keep this important pipeline operating. hoeven.senate.gov/news/news-…

Met w/ FSA Admin Ducheneaux & #NDag producers to discuss priorities for our nation's farm policy. With a new farm bill on the horizon, we are working to improve the farm safety net so our farmers and ranchers are in a strong position to weather difficult times.

As Americans hit the road over the recent holiday weekend, many noticed something that has become too familiar under the Biden admin - high prices at the gas pump. That hits everyone right in the pocketbook, particularly those who can afford it the least. piped.video/CALDMGREbXU

That’s exactly what we did in Grafton, Hazen & Rugby, where we worked with providers to leverage federal support and provide modern facilities with state-of-the-art equipment. We can do the same in Devils Lake.

Convened a meeting w/ Devils Lake Mayor, ND Health Comm. & leaders from Essentia, Altru & CHI on the future of health care in the Lake Region. Our health care workers do a tremendous job, but we need investment in facilities to attract more staff & better meet local needs.

w/ TRMC Director Rumford today showcasing the $500 million Sky Range complex to be developed at @GrandSkyND. This massive project will provide needed capabilities to more efficiently test hypersonic missiles, advancing nat. security & bringing long-term investment to Grand Forks.

At #AutonomousNation2023 today with the TRMC Director, where we announced the Sky Range hypersonic missile testing program is expanding to Fargo. Sky Range is a game-changer, & North Dakota plays an ever-more central role in this critical aspect of our national defense.
This is about ensuring access to affordable and reliable baseload power for homes and businesses that remains available 24/7, regardless of weather conditions.

Reviewed the operations of BNI’s new coal lease area at the Center Mine today. The operations are able to move forward due to our efforts to secure needed regulatory approval, which prevented $35 million in costs from being imposed on homeowners and businesses.

The Maah Daah Hey Trail is a world-class attraction for hikers, campers & bikers, bringing people from across the globe to ND. We're making the case to the Forest Service for a local plan to enhance the trailhead & ensure a quality experience for visitors.

Met w/ the USFS Deputy Chief and producers in McKenzie County to discuss issues impacting our livestock and energy industries. Outlined our work to reduce the federal regulatory burden, address prairie dogs & orphaned oil wells, + more.

This new hangar is part of General Atomics’ growing footprint in North Dakota. It’s fitting that General Atomics, the premier private sector trainer of unmanned aircraft pilots, is dedicating this new facility in Grand Forks, home of the premier school of aviation in the world.

Discussed w/ RMA Administrator & ND producers efforts to strengthen risk management tools for our farmers and ranchers. Crop insurance is the heart of the farm safety net, & we’re working to protect this important program, while giving producers more coverage options.

As North Dakota continues to grow due to our dynamic economy, we need affordable housing options for residents, particularly in the Fargo-Moorhead region. Lashkowitz Riverfront and Milton Earl are examples of the kinds of projects we need to meet this demand.
This mission places our state at the center of U.S. military operations, enabling members of every branch of our Armed Forces to execute their missions anywhere in the world.

Today announced that we’ve worked with the Space Development Agency to expand its LEO satellite mission at Grand Forks Air Force Base with the construction of the Satellite Test and Checkout Center. hoeven.senate.gov/news/news-…

Time and again, North Dakota’s Guard members have served our state and nation with distinction, and through efforts like this new readiness center in Dickinson, we’re working to ensure they continue having a track record of success in the wide array of missions they take on.

Helped break ground on the NDSU Extension Oakes Irrigation Research Site. This will strengthen NDSU’s role as a world-class ag institution, support producers & the local economy, & complement the Oakes Test Area infrastructure we transferred to local control in 2020.

At the Stockmen’s Livestock Exchange in Dickinson today to discuss & gather feedback on the cattle contract library program we established to improve transparency, competition and price discovery in cattle markets, as well as our efforts to strengthen livestock disaster programs.

The new, expanded runway at Dickinson Theodore Roosevelt Regional Airport will help ensure travel remains safe and reliable for both passengers and cargo. We secured $50 million for this project to help meet the needs of the community now and into the future.

Met today w/ producers, agribusiness & crop insurance providers in Leeds to gather input on the upcoming farm bill. Discussed efforts to improve and strengthen the farm safety net, incl. crop insurance, ARC & PLC.

It is time to reform our broken federal permitting system. American consumers pay the price for the regulatory uncertainty being imposed by the Biden admin. My bills will increase energy supply, which is essential to our economic and national security. piped.video/41Mae0R9eNA

Paid tribute to @FargoPolice Officer Jake Wallin on the floor of the U.S. Senate, honoring a life of tremendous service both defending our nation abroad and protecting us here at home. piped.video/ZjRXSHGAElk

The Biden admin won’t enforce the law because they want an open border policy. Joined my colleagues in calling on Pres. Biden to reinstate needed policies, resume construction of the border wall, & use the funding Congress has provided to secure the border & stop this crisis.
We stand with Israel. I joined Senator Cotton in introducing a resolution reaffirming our support for Israel, our strongest partner in the Middle East.

This tragic event is a reminder of the dangers our law enforcement officials face each and every day, and the enormous debt we owe them for their sacrifices to keep our communities safe. Our prayers are with the FPD & all our law enforcement officials during this difficult time.

Mikey & I are mourning with the Fargo community following the death of one of our brave peace officers, & send our deepest condolences to the loved ones of this officer. We are praying for those injured & the entire Fargo Police Department.

I joined Greta to discuss legislation I’m cosponsoring to stop China and other adversaries from purchasing U.S. farmland. We need to get tough on China to protect our national and economic security.
piped.video/kq-rJsi8sKo
We’ve created the right legal, tax and regulatory environment in our state to encourage economic growth, and attract high-paying jobs for our people.

North Dakota continues to lead the way – according to the BEA, our state had the highest growth of GDP and the highest increase in earnings in the nation during the first quarter of 2023. GDP increased by nearly 12.4%, and personal earnings increased at an annualized rate of 11%.

Mikey and I send our deepest condolences to the Knutson family, his many friends, and the entire community over this tragic loss. Mark was a pivotal figure, helping put Fargo-Moorhead on the map. We honor his memory and the lasting legacy he leaves behind.
Mikey and I wish everyone a safe and happy Independence Day. God bless!
Great to run into the West Fargo Packers Basketball team on their way to team camp in Bismarck. I hope they had a great time at camp and look forward to seeing them back on the court this fall.
Congrats to ND-born Zach Nehring on being drafted to the Winnipeg Jets. Best of luck – your home state is rooting for you.
Congrats to the Killdeer Saddle Club as they prepare to mark the 100th Mountain Roundup Rodeo next month. Received a great original print from artist Kay Burian celebrating the milestone.

Safety of the dam is a vital concern, but the draining of Lake Ilo has had real effects on landowners. We’re pressing USFWS to better coordinate with locals & expedite the dam repairs so the lake can be safely brought back to normal levels and re-stocked as quickly as possible.

The center would help ensure the policies being advanced in Washington, D.C. meet the needs of our farmers and ranchers in the Upper Midwest, complementing the work being done at institutions in Missouri, Texas and Nebraska.

hoeven.senate.gov/news/news-…

No one does agriculture better than North Dakota’s farmers and ranchers, and agriculture research plays a key role in our state’s competitive edge. The ag policy research center that we’re working to bring to NDSU builds upon this strong foundation.

Law enforcement put their safety + well-being on the line in order to protect our communities, & our efforts are all about ensuring they can access the training, tools and resources they need to keep people safe. Discussed this + more at the ND Chiefs of Police Annual Conference.

Congrats to @FarmRescueOrg on its 1000th farm assist. Farm Rescue has helped families keep  farms going when faced w/overwhelming challenges from illness & injury to natural disaster. This org embodies the spirit of community & lifts the burden on families when they are in need

Great to meet the Pheasants Forever National Youth Leaders, including North Dakotan Lexi Huntimer. Lexi and her dad, Randy, visited DC from Beulah. Lexi does a great job representing ND and advocating for Pheasants Forever and promoting the great outdoors.
Cosponsored a Senate Resolution recognizing the significance of Juneteenth Independence Day, and commemorating the end of slavery in the United States.

The flag stands for freedom and every day, but especially today, we wave the American flag with pride as we honor Old Glory and the independence it symbolizes. We will never forget those who’ve made sacrifices to defend it. Happy #FlagDay

We support the Governor’s request for a major disaster declaration due to spring flooding. The President needs to approve this request to unlock federal resources and help 21 North Dakota counties with flood recovery efforts.
We owe so much to the Greatest Generation and we’re reminded of that on #DDay as the beaches of Normandy were stormed by brave and dedicated American heroes.

While we would have preferred more savings, this legislation is far better than a debt ceiling increase with no spending reforms that the president first demanded, and is a step in the right direction as we continue working to rein in spending and control the debt and deficit.

The agreement enacts real permitting reforms & sets clear timelines for federal reviews – 2 years for an EIS & 1 year for an EA – to prevent delays & reduce costs for energy & other infrastructure projects, which is why the North Dakota Petroleum Council supports this legislation

According to the CBO, this is the largest spending cut in history, reducing the deficit by $2.1 trillion. The agreement reduces future discretionary spending to 1% growth while also clawing back COVID funds and strengthening work requirements for food assistance programs.

We should advance real solutions that help improve the affordability of higher education, incl. helping students attend cost-effective job training programs, & support the programs that Congress has already put in place to get financial assistance to students who need it most.

President Biden’s student loan debt cancellation does not get rid of the debt, it just pushes the costs on to taxpayers who did not go to college or have already paid off their loans. hoeven.senate.gov/news/news-…

We can never fully repay our veterans, but there are many ways we can work to honor their sacrifices and those of their families. The nearly $1.9 million investment we secured in the ND Veterans Cemetery’s new columbarium is one such effort, which we broke ground on today.

Memorial Day provides us with a renewed opportunity to come together as a nation to remember and honor those who made the ultimate sacrifice so that we may continue to live free, including the more than 2,900 North Dakotans who gave their lives serving in the Armed Forces.

Worked with Fargo city leaders to secure funding for Lashkowitz High Rise in Fargo to be safely demolished and new, high-quality, affordable housing to take its place in this prime location, serving the community for years to come.

This SCOTUS ruling is an important step towards reining in the Biden admin's repeated overreaches. We’ve been working to reverse this harmful WOTUS rule, & the lower courts should follow suit, preserve states’ authority and protect private property rights. hoeven.senate.gov/news/news-…

Today we broke ground on the Pipestem Dam safety modification project in Jamestown. This is vital for protecting residents against flooding, supports access to recreation opportunities, & is an investment in the continued safety and well-being of homes and business in the area.

With new @Meteomatics Meteodrone system at @GrandSkyND Weather Center – Grand Forks is equipped to support UAS operations unlike any other region in the world & will remain the premiere choice for companies looking to develop, test and implement advanced #UAStech.

Today’s meeting with the @FMWFChamber Agbiz Committee was about maintaining good farm policy in the farm bill & giving our farmers, ranchers and agribusinesses a voice in the process + delivering the tools they need to continue succeeding. hoeven.senate.gov/news/news-…

Every American needs to understand that the Biden admin doesn’t need more laws or tools to secure the border. They have the tools and law to do it, they just won’t. They want an open border. It’s way past time to end the border crisis.

Honored to be awarded the @PIANational 2023 Legislator of the Year Award. Crop insurance is the number one risk management tool for our farmers, and we have outstanding independent insurance agents who serve our communities well.

#NorthDakota continues leading the way in #CCUStech and this award to @undEERC & Coal Creek Station is the latest in our efforts to keep moving the development and commercially-viable implementation of this critical energy technology forward.  hoeven.senate.gov/news/news-…

North Dakota has a rich military tradition and as May marks #MilitaryAppreciationMonth we are so grateful for our military members and their families. We live in the greatest nation this world has ever known and that’s due to the great men and women in the U.S. military.

Cosponsored a Senate Res. to honor #NationalPoliceWeek. We are grateful for law enforcement officers in North Dakota & across the country and remain committed to ensuring they have the necessary equipment, training and support that they need to keep our communities safe.

With Sen. @SteveDaines, leading 14 of our colleagues in calling on the Bureau of Land Management to withdraw its proposed Public Lands Rule which locks away taxpayer-owned lands & undermines the multiple use requirements established by Congress. hoeven.senate.gov/news/news-…
Met with Mandaree students visiting Washington, D.C. last week with @Closeup_DC. We chatted about sports and their plans after graduation. A great group of kids, we wish them the best of luck.

With the expiration of Title 42, the crisis at the border is only getting worse. As I told Mike – the Biden admin needs to enforce the law and implement Remain in Mexico and the Third Safe Country protocols to stop the problem.

Every American needs to tell the Biden administration to enforce the law. That message needs to be heard across this country. We could stop this if the Biden administration enforced these policies and people knew they had to follow the law.

We are not just seeing an increase in illegal immigration, but also human & drug trafficking at the border. 

This could change immediately if the Biden administration truly enforced the Remain in Mexico and the Third Safe Country protocols.
Traveled to Brownsville, TX last night to meet with Border Patrol agents and see the surge of illegal immigration at the southern border as Title 42 expired.

Biden admin needs to enforce the law. By returning to the Remain in Mexico Protocol and strictly enforcing the Third Safe Country protocol, which we had under the prior administration, the professionals on the border can and will secure the border.

Heading down to the southern border to support Border Patrol professionals + cont. calling attention to the crisis made by the Biden admin. not enforcing the policies to stop drugs entering our country, illegal immigration & human trafficking.

Despite being blocked by SCOTUS, the Biden administration is once again advancing costly and overreaching rules meant to shutter baseload power plants, including coal-fired plants in #NorthDakota, putting the reliability and affordability of the electric grid at risk.
With Title 42 set to expire, the southern border crisis is now a catastrophe. Joined my colleagues in pressing Sec. Mayorkas to finish building the wall, enforce our laws and secure the border.

The end of the school year is near and we are wishing a happy teacher appreciation week to all teachers. We’re grateful for the dedicated teachers in #NorthDakota & across the nation who work tirelessly to help our students succeed and be prepared for the future.

Great having @USACEHQ leadership in the Red River Valley to showcase our first-in-the-nation comprehensive #floodprotection project utilizing the P3 model and WIFIA loan, providing a nationwide model for the U.S. to build projects on a quicker timeline & at a lower cost.

Energy security is national security and our leg. to reform the broken permitting & environmental review processes will create jobs, enhance our geopolitical competitiveness & bring down costs for families through increased American energy production. hoeven.senate.gov/news/news-…
Recently met with the @undeerc PCOR advisory board to receive an update on their work across a 13-state region & in four Canadian provinces to accelerate the deployment of #CCUStech.

Cosponsored a Senate Res. to honor National Nurses Week this week. Nurses provide an important role when it comes to health care & we are grateful for the men and women who work long hours offering care and compassion to patients in need.

Honored to join the @davNorthDakota annual convention in Mandan today. DAV does tremendous work on behalf of our vets and we appreciate their continued efforts to honor vets' sacrifices, while ensuring they receive the benefits/health care they have earned.

The Biden admin is putting emissions above our missions. We need to ensure that we are providing our soldiers with the best equipment possible to defend our country, not prioritizing green new deal mandates over the effectiveness and cost of our weapons systems.

We have great oncologists at the Sanford Roger Maris Cancer Center in #NorthDakota. I met with a few of them this week, who updated me on ways we can improve care for patients & work together on new treatments and one day, a cure. I appreciate the work they do.

With the Title 42 Public Health Order set to expire next week, the illegal immigration crisis at the southern border is only going to get worse. It’s past time for the Biden admin to get serious about securing our southern border.

Cosponsored a Senate Res. to designate today as the National Day of Awareness for Missing and Murdered Native Women and Girls. We remain committed to enhancing law enforcement training & improving public safety in tribal communities.

Small businesses are the engine of our economy, in #NorthDakota and across the nation. 

Cosponsored a Senate Res. to honor National #SmallBusinessWeek this week.

As I said on the floor this week, the Biden administration needs to take the handcuffs off American energy producers and work with us on bipartisan permitting reform. We need to empower our producers with a clear, consistent & timely federal permitting process.

Joined @SenJohnBarrasso in introducing leg. to protect multiple use policy on federal lands. The Bureau of Land Management needs to withdraw its proposal, which locks away federal lands and hamstrings the multiple uses North Dakotans depend on.hoeven.senate.gov/news/news-…

We owe our veterans so much and it was an honor to extend my thanks to the nearly 100 ND & MN veterans of the Vietnam and Korean Wars, as well as their loved ones & Honor Flight volunteers, who recently visited Washington, D.C. to see the monuments and memorials.

We need to get our debt and deficit under control, and spending reforms should be part of an agreement to raise the debt ceiling. The President needs to sit down with Speaker McCarthy and get this thing done.

With less than 20% of the farm bill directly supporting ag producers, we need to make sure crop insurance, ARC & PLC are effective. Discussed this at our @SenateAgGOP hearing this week with the leaders of the nation’s two largest farm organizations, @FarmBureau + @NFUDC.

At our @EnergyGOP hearing today, pressed Sec. Haaland to stop blocking oil and gas production on federal lands and to comply with the law, hold the required lease sales and take the handcuffs off U.S. energy production.

Extending the moratorium for health care facilities & LTC providers serving vets for an additional 2 years is welcome news, providing a level of certainty and reg. relief, but we need to make this exemption permanent, just as DoL did for TRICARE providers. bit.ly/3Lo6B40

The #floodprotection that we’ve worked hard to advance in the Red River Valley is a first-in-the-nation project and has created a new paradigm for U.S. Army Corps projects. I appreciate Chief Spellmon’s continued commitment to keep this effort moving forward.

Making good progress on flood protection & have secured funding and authorization to advance permanent flood protection for the majority of the Minot region. We’ll continue working with the Corps to find creative solutions to complete this project.
Appreciate ND Insurance Commissioner Jon Godfread updating me on insurance issues in #NorthDakota including health insurance, flood insurance and data privacy.

Met with juniors and seniors from Ellendale and Linton this week. They asked great questions and updated us on their teams and clubs. We really appreciate the teachers and chaperones who take the time to bring #NorthDakota students out to D.C.

Sat down with @NDStockmen this week to discuss priorities for the farm bill & our efforts to push back against the administration’s heavy-handed regulations. Appreciate all that our ranchers do & as a senior member of @SenateAgGOP, we remain committed to supporting their efforts.

In Minot today marking the grand opening of the Magic City Discovery Center. We worked to secure funding for this interactive STEAM educational center to help enrich the lives of families & children in the region for years to come.

At our Approps hearing this week, stressed the importance of the Eastern ND Alternate Water Supply Project with Commissioner Touton as it will serve as a critical tool to ensure the Red River Valley has a reliable water supply when it is needed most. hoeven.senate.gov/news/news-…
Caught up with representatives from Sanford Health and Essentia Health to discuss how impactful the 340B drug pricing program is to providers across North Dakota.

Given that DAPL has been operating safely for nearly six years, utilizing the best safeguards and latest technology, the Army Corps needs to promptly bring the EIS process to completion and provide certainty for all those who rely upon this critical pipeline.
Met with North Dakota insurers and talked about several issues, including the need to keep crop insurance strong in the upcoming farm bill.

After recently traveling to South Korea, today we heard from South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol. We have been allies, partners and friends with South Korea since 1953 & we look forward to continuing close diplomatic, economic and military relations.

Our veterans have earned their VA benefits & shouldn’t be forced to travel long distances or move from their home communities just to access the health care they need. At our Approps hearing this week, urged VA Sec McDonough to help us secure permanent regulatory relief for vets.

The EPA’s rule, which targets our trucking industry, will hinder our already constrained supply chain & lead to higher costs for U.S. consumers. Helped intro, then voted for this CRA to stop the Biden admin from once again imposing costly & burdensome regs.bit.ly/3NfXPaM

Met with @EssentiaHealth last week and we appreciate their commitment to #NorthDakota, particularly in their work to ensure that rural communities continue to have access to quality care and emergency health care services.
Recently met with Garrison Diversion to discuss their efforts to enhance access to high quality and affordable water supplies for North Dakota communities.

My trip to Taiwan and South Korea convinced me even more that our highest priority should be to cultivate close security and economic relationships with our fellow democratic and free market allies and partners.
Watch my full remarks on the Senate floor:  piped.video/watch?v=QL8fo67V…
Today kicks off #NationalParkWeek and North Dakota is proud to be home of the @TRooseveltNPS. To celebrate, the @NatlParkService is offering free admission today.

Fielded questions from @NAFB reporters in D.C. this week. We discussed a variety of my priorities for the upcoming farm bill including crop insurance and safety-net programs for farmers & access to free and fair trade agreements.

Wishing a very happy birthday to Finley-Sharon student Justina this week. Met her and a great group of students from Finley-Sharon and Hebron High Schools while they’re in town with @Closeup_DC. We sang happy birthday of course & they shared their plans for the future with me.

This week I heard from telecom professionals about the importance of working to ensure access to broadband. Appreciate the incredible job hard working North Dakotans have done to advance this goal, as it’s critical in rural states like ours.

Christian Elmer interned in my D.C. office this spring. We appreciate his hard work and wish him the best of luck as he returns to his senior year at Concordia College where he’s triple majoring in political science, accounting & business management.

At our SAC-D hearing this week, spoke to @SecAFOfficial Kendall, @GenCQBrownJr & @SpaceForceCSO Saltzman about modernization of U.S. nuclear forces + strengthening our defense ties in the Pacific so our allies and partners can push back against China and North Korea.
Met with @NDAREC members including future leaders Brody, Brekyn and Julia, in D.C. this week to discuss reliable, affordable energy throughout the state, region and country.

Met with Taiwan President Tsai @iingwen this week to reaffirm support for Taiwan & the importance of strengthening long-standing economic and defense ties to promote peace and prosperity in the Pacific region. bit.ly/40bAIAV

The Federal Court’s injunction to block implementation of Biden’s WOTUS rule is a welcome relief from the ever-growing, burdensome regs being pushed by this admin & we will continue working to provide regulatory relief + prevent the harmful and costly Green New Deal agenda.

After visiting the DMZ and meeting with our South Korean allies, it is clear that we must continue to modernize U.S. forces, including the nuclear forces in North Dakota, to ensure peace and prosperity in the region.

We have been allies, partners and friends since 1953. This military alliance is critical to preserving peace in the region. Deterring North Korean aggression depends on a joint Korean and U.S. conventional force backed by a modernized and credible U.S. nuclear deterrent.

Met with government, military and agriculture leaders in Seoul to strengthen military and ag trade ties with South Korea as this year marks the 70th anniversary of the alliance between the United States and South Korea.

Intro’d legislation with @SenKevinCramer & @RepArmstrongND to allow public land and mineral rights transfers between state, tribes and federal government in North Dakota. hoeven.senate.gov/news/news-…
He is risen, he is risen indeed. Mikey and I would like to wish all North Dakotans a happy Easter.
As we observe Holy Week, today on Good Friday we commemorate the crucifixion of Jesus Christ and the death he endured for us.

Our electrical grid can't afford to lose the reliable/ affordable baseload power provided by coal-fired power plants. Instead of costly & duplicative mandates like this new MATS rule, the Biden admin should work with us to advance new innovations to utilize all energy resources.

Our legislation to restore the NCC’s mission would help advance efforts to ensure stability & reliability of the grid + develop new innovations, like we’re doing with CCUS in ND, to secure coal’s future in America’s energy mix while reducing emissions. hoeven.senate.gov/news/news-…

Met in Bismarck today to establish coordination between government agencies and ensure the region is prepared for potential spring flooding in Burleigh & Morton counties as they have experienced historic levels of snowfall this winter.
hoeven.senate.gov/news/news-…

ND + western states depend on access to federal lands. The Biden admin’s proposed rule seeks to lock away more federal lands in direct conflict w longstanding multiple use law. We’re working to stop this proposal & ensure ND + others still have access to these public lands.

It is no coincidence that #NorthDakota is starting to lead the conversation when it comes to the possibility of food production in space. This is both an important aspect of future U.S. manned space missions & an opportunity to advance new tech + our nation’s food security.

Helped kick off @EmergingPrairie & @UofNorthDakota’s Space Ag Conference today & outlined the convergence of North Dakota’s leadership in agriculture with the state’s growing role in U.S. space operations and research.

Communities across the Red River Valley understand the risk of annual flooding, and today’s meeting with city, county & federal authorities is about ensuring officials at all levels of government are coordinating their response efforts.

As we’re working on the Ag Approps bill for FY24 and preparing for the upcoming farm bill, I discussed a variety of topics related to rural America, farming, ranching & agribusinesses with @midwestcouncil1 this week while they were in Washington, D.C.

Window & Door Manufacturers were in DC this week & I met with WDMA members Cardinal IG and Marvin to discuss efforts to support a positive economic climate for businesses and manufacturers in #NorthDakota.

The Biden admin needs to expand domestic energy production to increase supply & bring down costs. The U.S. is fortunate to have abundant and affordable reserves of coal, oil and gas, and these resources could be produced with the best environmental stewardship here at home.
We have exceptional schools in #NorthDakota and this week I met with principals from across the state to hear an update on how their school years are going, future plans and workforce challenges.

Along with @SenKevinCramer, we met with students from across #NorthDakota this week while they were visiting our nation’s capital. The students asked a variety of questions & updated us on their plans for the future. Wishing them a great rest of the school year.
Given that the DOJ and FEC declined to bring charges in this matter, the Manhattan DA’s case appears to be politically motivated.
This week I heard from Ellen & Reba, #NorthDakota reps with the @LungAssociation, about the latest efforts to promote research, treatment & prevention of lung disease.

UAS test sites, including @NPUASTS, are at the center of our efforts to ensure aircraft can be safely integrated into our national airspace. This legislation supports their ongoing work + dovetails with the new BVLOS waivers we recently secured.

Introduced legislation with Sen. @MarkWarner this week to support the research and development of #UAStech at the nation’s UAS test sites. UAS play a crucial role in our country’s defense & there is tremendous potential yet to be realized.  bit.ly/3LZ25uN

Energy security is national security – which is why we’re working w/ @undeerc @Basin_Electric @MinnkotaPower and Rainbow Energy to crack the code on CCUS and continue leveraging our abundant lignite resources.

The Biden admin’s WOTUS rule would affect nearly all waters in #NorthDakota, even temporary and seasonal standing water, impacting businesses across our economy. That’s why today I voted to overturn this federal overreach.
Sat down with city administrators from Fargo & Grand Forks to hear about economic development opportunities in the Red River Valley.
On this day, we remember and honor all United States veterans who served in the Vietnam War.  We commend your bravery and eternally thank you for your service to our great nation.

Today U.S. District Court Judge Traynor ordered the BLM to resume oil & gas lease sales for federal lands in North Dakota. This decision is a welcome step to hold the Biden admin accountable & ensure they hold quarterly lease sales required by law.

Energy security is national security & this week I introduced 2 energy bills in the Senate to help provide certainty for cross-border energy facilities + streamline multi-agency NEPA reviews of natural gas projects needed to get energy to market. bit.ly/3zbDbR9

#NorthDakota is home to 13 @TRIOASPIRE programs across the state and I recently caught up with ASPIRE leadership & ND teachers for an update on their efforts to help equip students for higher education.

CBP along w/ the Canada Border Services Agency will extend the operating hours for the Maida, Northgate and Sherwood ports of entry in #NorthDakota from 9 AM to 7 PM for 120 days, starting April 1. This is a step in the right direction, but more needs to be done.
Over 100 North Dakota juniors and seniors were in D.C. last week w/ Close Up viewing national monuments and visiting museums. Wishing them the best of luck in their studies this school year.

Great news – FAA has approved a new waiver allowing @NPUASTS to support UAS flights involving aircraft that do not have a public designation, giving #NorthDakota an even greater competitive edge in the industry. bit.ly/40BfMnG

The Forest Service’s management policies for the National Grasslands has a tremendous impact on western North Dakota’s economy, particularly for ranchers and energy producers. Discussed this & more with USFS Chief Moore this week as he committed to visit ND.

Today on National Medal of Honor Day we commemorate the men and women in uniform who have gone above & beyond the call of duty to serve our nation. They have displayed the highest level of valor and we are grateful, today & every day, for their sacrifices.

Along with @SenKevinCramer & @RepArmstrongND, we are urging POTUS to approve Gov. @DougBurgum’s request for a presidential disaster declaration for January’s severe weather storms that caused power outages & frozen electrical infrastructure. bit.ly/40dsQ2T

Sat down with Doosan Bobcat CEO and president Scott Park & Mike Ballweber, president of the company's North America division, this week to discuss the company’s work in North Dakota & around the world.
Met with water utility directors from Bismarck and Fargo to discuss their efforts to maintain affordable and reliable access to clean drinking water.
Received an update from Trinity Health Minot CEO John Kutch this week as they prepare to open their new facility next month.

Cosponsored a Senate Resolution designating today as National Women in Ag Day. Today and every day we honor the important impact women have in all facets of the ag industry across North Dakota & the country.

Once again calling on POTUS to address the illegal immigration crisis at our southern border. On the Senate floor I stressed the national security risk, humanitarian issues including human trafficking and drug smuggling & impact it’s having on northern border operations.

Between Sky Range, Global Hawk operations and the LEO satellite mission, #NorthDakota is already playing a major role in our nation’s defense & kicked off @UofNorthDakota’s SOaRS event today addressing how the stratosphere offers even more opportunities to enhance that security.

Every day is #NationalAgDay in #NorthDakota and we’re incredibly grateful for the farmers & ranchers who work tirelessly snow or shine to provide the food, fuel & fiber we need. It’s a privilege to work for them every day, but especially as part of the upcoming #farmbill.

Great news—the waivers we secured from the FAA, as well as those we cont. to advance, will put the Grand Forks region on track to enhance its BVLOS operations, while we bring in additional economic benefits through Sky Range. bit.ly/3lw6b2M

Met with students from Hazelton, #NorthDakota while they were in town with @Closeup_DC. They told me about their latest hunts and commented on the pheasant, bison and other game displayed in my office. I enjoyed hearing about their studies, as well.

The @NDNationalGuard serves our state & nation in countless ways, and its members always do so with distinction. We are tremendously proud of their important work, whether it’s along the southern border, in our nation’s capital, overseas or conducting missions right here at home.
Discussed a variety of topics including the upcoming farm bill with #NDag producers visiting DC with @NorthernCanola.
Wishing the best of luck to the @UNDmhockey players, coaches & the entire Sea of Green tonight at the #FrozenFaceoff in St. Paul. #UNDproud

There are real challenges that we are working to address as we write the next farm bill. This week I made the case for #NDag priorities in the upcoming farm bill to @SecVilsack in our @SenateAgGOP committee hearing.
Visited with members of Mid-West Electric Consumers Association in D.C. this week to discuss maintaining access to affordable & reliable baseload power for consumers.

The president’s budget is the wrong proposal at the wrong time. Congress must work to find savings, reduce our debt & deficit and responsibly fund priorities without increasing taxes on hard-working American families.

Spring months bring #NorthDakota students to Capitol Hill with @Closeup_DC. I met with seniors from Ray High School last week while they were visiting Washington, D.C. Great group of students & wish them the best of luck with their future plans.

Met with members of the North Dakota School Nutrition Association this week. As Ranking Member of the Senate Ag. Appropriations Committee it was beneficial to hear their feedback as we begin the FY24 process.

We’re grateful for Alice and her willingness to serve as the National AMVETS Ladies Auxiliary Chaplain & represent ND so well. This week she was in Washington, D.C. updating me on her priorities for the year and efforts to support veterans.

As we’ve worked for more than two decades to build our region into a hub of tech entrepreneurship, appreciate everyone who helped make the Great Northern Regional Robotics Competition a reality & wish the best of luck to all North Dakota students competing.

The American Aviator Act of 2023 I intro’d this week with @SenatorBaldwin is about expanding flight-training services for vets who want to become commercial airline pilots & will help address our nation’s pilot shortage. hoeven.senate.gov/news/news-…

Met with members of the VFW this week. We remain committed to supporting #NDveterans and as our brave men and women leave military service, we must ensure they receive the health care, benefits and recognition they have earned.

Will of Jamestown & Gavin of Hankinson are representing #NorthDakota this week in the @SenateYouth Program. This is a highly competitive, merit-based program that provides students with opportunities to learn more about the government. Big congratulations to both of them.
This week I met with @PCACHAD leadership to hear an update on health centers across North Dakota and efforts to improve access to quality health care in our communities.

Our nation needs to get its fiscal house in order. President Biden’s budget request released today for FY24 is just more of the same big government policies that have weakened the U.S. economy and led to historic levels of inflation for American consumers. bit.ly/3yrAo5K

Crime is at a 25-year high across the country. We must get serious about public safety and addressing the nationwide rise in crime by supporting law enforcement & ensuring they have the resources + training they need to protect our communities.

The @NDSUmbb team battles Oral Roberts tonight in the Summit League Championship game. Wishing players, coaches & all of #BisonNation the best of luck as the winning team earns their ticket to the big dance.

After a move, military spouses can face challenges when re-entering the workforce in their new communities. The Military Spouse Hiring Act will help fulfill needs in the workforce while encouraging employers to support military families. bit.ly/3L08ZPO

Sat down with members of the ND Broadcasters Association while they were in DC for their nationwide annual conference & discussed efforts to cont. promoting access to local community news plus of course coverage of ND sports teams.

Between basketball, volleyball and track, Gianna found time in her busy schedule to fly out to D.C. this week with her dad TJ & ND potato growers. Great meeting her and wish her the best of luck with the rest of seventh grade.

As we cont. laying the groundwork for the upcoming farm bill here in DC, this week I heard from #NDag producers w/ @NDFarmersUnion, ND Grain Growers, @NDSoyGrowers & NPPGA to discuss a variety of their priorities.

As the head of NORTHCOM and NORAD, General VanHerck is in charge of securing our national airspace & we think North Dakota has a lot of resources that could be brought to bear in terms of countering UAPs and how to better address these national security concerns.
Met with North Dakota Civil Air Patrol cadets this week. CAP provides essential services, keeps North Dakotans safe & starts great aviation careers.

For decades we’ve worked hard to advance UAS, national security and much more in the Grand Forks region. This week I met with @UofNorthDakota leadership to discuss continued efforts and opportunities to make North Dakota a leader in all things air & space.
Met with @PrairiePublic this week & they caught me up on their priorities for the year.

Visited with Valley City Mayor Dave Carlsrud and Gwen Crawford this week to discuss the importance of 24/7 baseload power generation and @MRESnews efforts to provide affordable and reliable power to North Dakota communities.

North Dakota native Vincent Compeau enlisted in the U.S. Army in 1980. He served as a paratrooper and infantryman in the 82nd Airborne Division. Before he passed away in November, his last wish was to have one final jump over Ft. Bragg & this week we helped make that happen.
At the same time, #NDveterans were in D.C. with the @AmericanLegion & appreciated the opportunity to introduce General Bussiere to them. Grateful for our men and women in uniform, past & present.🇺🇸
Met with Gen. Thomas Bussiere, @AFGlobalStrike Commander to discuss the good work of the airmen at @TeamMinot Air Force Base.

My BLM Mineral Spacing Act we intro’d strengthens U.S. domestic energy production by streamlining + improving the permitting process for energy development plus it removes duplicative regulations 
and better respects the rights of private mineral holders.bit.ly/3YaYoo2
As I told Sec. Becerra, it’s time we support health care providers and not continue burdening them with COVID-19 mandates that are not necessary nor feasible. hoeven.senate.gov/news/news-…

In Minot today discussing regional mail delivery service & efforts to resolve issues. Mail service is essential for individuals, families and businesses, who rely on USPS to deliver everything from life-saving medications to bills and financial documents. hoeven.senate.gov/news/news-…

With illegal crossings along the northern border up 300%, today’s meeting w/ Border Patrol was about our ongoing efforts to provide them with resources to properly staff and secure the northern border + prevent human trafficking and drug smuggling. hoeven.senate.gov/news/news-…

ND’s role in the defense of our nation + the UAS industry continues to grow. Today I toured Packet Digital’s new battery manufacturing facility in Fargo - putting ND at the center of the Navy’s UAS supply chain. hoeven.senate.gov/news/news-…

The Farm Bill plays an important role in supporting local leaders, like the RRRA, in managing water resources & protecting communities against the risk of flooding. We remain committed to cont. to advance this farmer-friendly approach. bit.ly/3YQkzRN

County officials from across North Dakota were in DC this week for the 2023 NACo Legislative Conference. They stopped by to update me on issues across the state and priorities for the upcoming farm bill.

Senate passed a resolution I supported honoring National #FFAWeek & recognizing the great work @NationalFFA & @NDFFA does to support the future of agriculture and cultivate student leaders for the future.

I met with the @NDMedAssn to discuss a wide range of issues impacting physicians in North Dakota. Access to quality health care shouldn’t depend on one’s zip code, and I appreciate the hard work of our North Dakota doctors.

The Biden administration is taking our country in the wrong direction, driving up energy prices and reaching record high inflation. As I told Larry, we need to get back to the fundamentals that make our country strong and empower hardworking Americans.
YMCAs provide important services that contribute to the overall wellness of our communities. This week I caught up with YMCA officials from North Dakota while they were visiting DC.

Had a productive sit-down discussion with the ND Center for Rural Health this week. We talked about the importance of health care in our rural communities and the tremendous day-in and day-out work of providers in these facilities.

At the Valley Crop Insurance annual meeting I outlined our @SenateAgGOP hearing this week w/ key USDA officials where we continued our efforts to maintain strong farm policy in the upcoming farm bill including risk management programs & the farm safety net.bit.ly/40SjF8D

Thanked @BPUnion President Brandon Judd this week for the hard work Border Patrol professionals are doing at our southern border, despite the policies of the Biden admin. I’ve met many of these hard-working men & women on my trips to the border & greatly appreciate their efforts.
Enjoyed talking to #NorthDakota Pulse Growers this week to make sure the #2023FarmBill gives #NDag producers the tools they need.

Border security is national security. The Biden admin’s refusal to enforce our laws is incentivizing illegal immigration and creating a human and drug trafficking crisis at the southern border. Joined @SenKatieBritt & my colleagues in intro’ing border security legislation.

Walsh Rural Water District was recently voted the “best water in North Dakota” for 2023 & ND Rural Water Association members stopped by this week as they’re in DC for the National Rural Water Association’s annual rally.
Sat down with #NorthDakota Barley Council this week to talk 2023 Farm Bill priorities. We discussed the importance of crop insurance, trade & ag research.

As I discussed with @dagenmcdowell and @SeanDuffyWI, President Biden’s remarks re: oil at the SOTU drew a big push back from the crowd because it’s his own admin that’s placed handcuffs on U.S. energy producers & is driving up prices for consumers.
The Biden administration is taking our country in the wrong direction. Below is my full statement following President Biden’s State of the Union address tonight: bit.ly/3XdGHE2

This week Friends of the Children–Fargo-Moorhead updated me on the positive impacts of mentoring and investing in our at-risk youth. They do incredible work for ND youth & I am encouraged by the great accomplishments they’ve achieved in Fargo.
Our health care workforce is indispensable, and I enjoyed meeting with nurse practitioners to talk about ways to improve and grow the profession in North Dakota.

In Grand Forks today to announce funding we secured for @undEERC to advance needed monitoring technologies that will play a central role in the commercially-viable implementation of #CCUS. ND is leading the way in developing this critical energy tech.

We’ve heard an outpouring of concerns from North Dakotans regarding the Nat'l Park Service’s plan to remove the wild horses at Theodore Roosevelt National Park. Convened a meeting with state and NPS leadership to outline importance of maintaining wild horses at the park.

The Biden admin’s expanded WOTUS definition goes far beyond the authority granted by Congress & I joined the CRA to rescind it. Rather, we should provide regulatory relief and take a states-first approach to protecting our land and water that respects private property rights.

On the Senate floor this week I outlined the impact of historic inflation and price increases on American consumers driven by the Biden administration’s continued regulatory overreach, failure to empower our domestic energy producers and failed economic policies.

As we have recommended, we believe the city should discontinue the Fufeng project and instead we should work together to find an American company to develop the agriculture project. hoeven.senate.gov/news/news-…

Today @SenKevinCramer and I released the following statement after the U.S. Air Force made very clear in their letter to us that the Fufeng project represents a national security risk due to proximity to the Grand Forks Air Force Base...

W/ the cattle contract library now live, ranchers will be better positioned to market&sell their livestock, securing a better price for their products. This library comes as part of our cont. efforts to ensure producers can access fair+competitive markets. bit.ly/40hQlrV
A big congratulations to J.J. Franks, I played many basketball games in that gym and never made a shot like that. Way to go!

We will never forget the millions of victims of the horrors of the Holocaust & we remain committed to remembering the survivors. Today we commemorate #HolocaustRemembranceDay and mark 78 years since Auschwitz-Birkenau was liberated.

Great to meet Maura, the therapy dog being trained at Hillsboro High School. I appreciate Superintendent Suda, Principal Baesler, & Ag Instructor Reese for taking the time to discuss this pilot program for increasing student access to behavioral health support.

At ND Grain Dealers convention this week, outlined our efforts to maintain strong farm policy to benefit both #NDag producers & American consumers, incl. gathering feedback on the next Farm Bill and ensuring reliable ocean & rail transportation services. hoeven.senate.gov/news/news-…
Today we honor and remember the life and legacy of the courageous civil rights activist Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. and his commitment to justice and equality for all.
Today and every day we are grateful for the work of law enforcement officers as they protect our communities.

Today we welcomed home members of the @NDNationalGuard as they returned from the southern border where they worked over the past year to stem the tide of illegal immigration, drug smuggling and human trafficking into our nation.
The @NDSUfootball program put up a great fight today against the Jackrabbits. All of #BisonNation is proud of their efforts this season.

Good luck to #BisonNation today as they battle the SDSU Jackrabbits to claim yet another #FCSChampionship in Frisco. We are very proud of the entire @NDSUfootball program as they’ve worked hard this season and wish them a strong finish. #GoBison

Thread is developing a UAS solution to enhance perimeter security at GFAFB. This award continues our work to ensure this critical base is secure against threats and can continue to support the unmanned ISR missions that our warfighters depend on. bit.ly/3VQA6P6

Today, with Mikey by my side, I once again took the oath of office as a U.S. Senator for the great state of North Dakota. I look forward to continuing to work hard for all North Dakotans & addressing the real issues impacting American households.
Today as we turn our calendars to 2023, Mikey and I would like to wish you much health and happiness in the year ahead.
